hanze.PIV1E.leertaak2.music

Class MusicHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • hanze.PIV1E.leertaak2.music.MusicHandler

  • public class MusicHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles the playing of the music.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MusicHandler(SimulationModel model)
      Creates a MusicHandler.

      void addMusicFile(java.lang.String name, MusicFile file)
      Adds a MusicFile to the MusicHandler.
      void adjustSound()
      Gives a menu to adjust all sounds.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,MusicFile> getMusicFiles()
      returns all the MusicFiles the MusicHandler has.
      void muteAllSound()
      Sets all the sound volumes to its lowest.
      void resetDefaults()
      resets all the sounds to their default volume

      Plays the MusicFile once.

      Starts infinite playing of the given MusicFile.
      void stop(MusicFile file)
      Stops the MusicFile.

      Unmutes all the sounds.

                         MusicFile file)
        Adds a MusicFile to the MusicHandler.
        Parameters:
        file - MusicFile to be added

      • muteAllSound

        public void muteAllSound()
        Sets all the sound volumes to its lowest. Does not stop the music!

      • unMuteAllSound

        public void unMuteAllSound()
        Unmutes all the sounds.

      • adjustSound

        public void adjustSound()
        Gives a menu to adjust all sounds.

      • startInfinite

        public void startInfinite(MusicFile file)
        Starts infinite playing of the given MusicFile.
        Parameters:
        file - the MusicFile to be played

      • start

        public void start(MusicFile file)
        Plays the MusicFile once.
        Parameters:
        file - the MusicFile to be started

      • stop

        public void stop(MusicFile file)
        Stops the MusicFile.
        Parameters:
        file - the MusicFile to be stopped

      • resetDefaults

        public void resetDefaults()
        resets all the sounds to their default volume
